name: N,N-dibenzylhydroxylamine
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base, with a melting point around 50 degrees Celsius, due to the presence of two phenyl groups, which can significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the hydroxylamine group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The presence of two methoxy groups can also contribute to the melting point, albeit at a lower extent than the phenyl group, estimated at around +2°C each.
